result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian T Kronquist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian T Kronquist

records.addlTxt: Civil Judgment not entered--Balance is Paid in full.  (tg--9/21/20)
Letter from ADA Shock in regards to Documents 81 & 82.
Court's response to Defendant's 10/26/18 letter; State- other than objection to my granting motion any objection to what he has written here?

(SF) Case called at 1:59 pm
Defendant Brian T Kronquist in custody, via video from Oakhill Correctional. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the video sight and sound sufficient.
ADA Teuber presents argument against the Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.
Defendant gives statement as to not being able to get any programming.
Court and defendant discuss whether he has been given any programming.
ADA Teuber advises that the Defendant is on the list for 3 different treatment programs, and that he is eligible for ERP however since he only has 4 months left he would not have enough time left to complete it.

Court inquires of the defendant how he did the math to come to 75% of time served. 
Defendant advises that the records department would not have sent the petition for sentence adjustment if he had not meet the 75% of time served.

Defendant indicates that he believes that he would have hit his 75% of time served on this sentence the first week of October.
Court and ADA Teuber discuss the Verifcation of Time Served and the amount of time served listed by DOC and the paperwork attached doesn't match.

Court presents basis and grants the defendant's motion but will hold off on signing the Order until the 16th of November.

recess: 2:28 pm
Sentence adjustment review on October 19, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

Transcript of Arraignment, Plea and Sentencing (Prison) 9/19/17

[MK] cases #15CF355 & #15CM180 & #17CM178 called at 1:42pm. 
Defendant Brian T Kronquist in court , in custody, with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Initial Appearance and Plea Hearing is held in Case #17CM178 only: 
Service of the Amended Complaint is admitted; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Domestic Abuse finding is made. 
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 & #2. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sentencing Hearing is held in all three cases: 

In Case #15CM180 on Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Kronquist to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, the Court finds that the 67 days-credit results in a time-served jail term
--67 days credit for time already served given
--the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any unpaid court costs, fees and surcharges.  
----------------------------

In case #15CF355-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Kronquist to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year & 6 months.  This sentence is consecutive to Case #15CM180. 
Days credit for time already served:  26 days. 

In case #17CM178-Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Kronquist to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is concurrent with Case #15CF355.
Days credit for time already served:  0 days.   

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" in both Case #15CF355 and #17CM178.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program in both Case #15CF355 and #17CM178.

In both Case #15CF355 and #17CM178, the Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or an education program as supervised by the Agent 
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to submit a DNA sample 

In both Case #15CF355 and #17CM178, the Court orders entry of civil judgments for court costs, fees, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.
recess 2:18pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] cases # 15CF355 & #15CM180 called at 3: 32pm. 
Defendant Brian T Kronquist in court , in custody,  with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
After a discussion with counsel, the Court concludes that it needs to review the transcription of the 8/30/16 [Continuation of the ] Sentencing Hearing that was held in Case #15CF355 before proceeding with the Sentencing After Revocation in these cases. 
The Court orders the preparation of a transcript of the 8/30/16 hearing in Case #15CF355.
The Court and counsel discuss that Mr. Kronquist will remain housed at the Jefferson County Jail until the 9/19/17 hearing. 
recess 3:42pm. 
[Post Hearing: the Court indicates to the clerk that the court report R.G. has been contacted about the preparation of the subject transcript.]

NEXT:  rescheduled Sentencing After Revocation on 9/19/17 at 1:30pm.  [JA-post hearing counsel asked that Mr. Kronquist's pending case #17CM178 be scheduled for hearing on this same date and time; there is a realization that this case is currently assigned to Branch I.]

Defendant Brian T Kronquist in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2-15CF355 & Count #1-15CM180; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1, #3 & #4-15CF355 & Counts #2 & #3-15CM180
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referrals of Retail Theft from Mendards in Johnson Creek on the dates of 3/25/15, 3/26/15 & 4/26/15 and bars them from further prosecution.
Sentencing arguments by ADA Beck; Atty Svehlek submits Custody Credit Worksheet; Sentencing Arguments by Atty Svehlek
Court discusses new program developed by the reducing recidivism counsel and the Dave Gallup Foundation & provides options for parties
off-record: 12:16 - 12:17 pm 
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Kronquist is very interested in the program and would like to consider the Dave Gallup portion of sentence as he belives it would be of benefit to him, but would like to proceed with the probationary term of sentencing today and address jail at later date as Court proposed as Mr. Kronquist does have pending warrants that the would like to address. 
No objection by ADA Beck

On Count #2-15CF355, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions as adopted on the criminal case settlement, except conditional jail, which include:
On Count #1-15CM180, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions as adopted on the criminal case settlement, which include:

Court adjourns sentencing as it relates to jail on felony curt and whether or not that will be with or without Huber. Court will make recommendation to Dave Gallup Foundation and schedule continued sentencing in no sooner than 60 days as that is how much time the Foundation has indicated that they will need.
